author: Faith Fernandez
title: St. Philip the Apostle School Students Unite for 2nd Annual Christian Service Day - Pasadena Schools
text:
[Read Previous Post](https://www.pasadenanow.com/pasadenaschools/spusd-receives-sizeable-grant-support-from-south-pasadena-chinese-american-club/)
St. Philip the Apostle School Students Unite for 2nd Annual Christian Service Day
St. Philip the Apostle School (SPAS) as a Catholic institution, fosters a strong culture of service among its students. In keeping with this tradition, SPAS students united for their 2nd Annual Christian Service Day, an event dedicated to giving back to the community. With a deep commitment to living out the values of faith, compassion, and charity, students of all grade levels worked together on various service projects, contributing their time and talents to make a positive impact on those in need. This annual event not only strengthens the studentsâ€™ sense of community, but also inspires them to continue serving others throughout the year.
St. Philip the Apostle School, 1363 Cordova St., Pasadena, (626) 795-9691 or visit [https://school.stphiliptheapostle.org/](https://school.stphiliptheapostle.org/).

author: @prokerala
title: Win over India massive for us; South Africa have really gelled as a unit, says Shukri Conrad
text: Centurion, Dec 29 : Following a win by an innings and 32 runs over India in the first Test at SuperSport Park, South Africa head coach Shukri Conrad thinks the victory was a massive one for his side and believes the hosts' are starting to gel well as a unit at home. South Africa's win was set up by opener Dean Elgar, who will retire after the two-Test series, scoring a majestic 185, followed by Marco Jansen making a career-best 84 not out and debutant David Bedingham making 56. The trio's efforts meant South Africa made 408 in their first innings and took a 163-run lead on day three. Led by left-arm pacer Nandre Burger's 4-33, taking his match haul to seven scalps, South Africa skittled out India for just 131 in 34.1 overs, to complete a resounding win in three days. "This win was massive for us and what makes it bigger is that it makes sure India have never beaten us in a Test series here. We know what a quality side India are, but we also know what we are, especially at home. We are a brilliant team at home and we have really gelled as a unit." "A lot of the time that has been about freeing the guys up, allowing them to be the best versions of themselves. People have questioned whether South Africa still produce good players and we have shown that we do. Sometimes we are too humble as a group." "We are so easy to talk up other players and we don't give our own players the credit. Nandre (Burger) is massive and (David) Bedingham too ... its time we start drooling over our players. These guys are absolutely phenomenal and we have put succession plans in place. You need a bit of luck and things will fall into place," said Conrad after the match ended. Elgar's 185, on his final Test match at his home ground, allowed South Africa to not just survive in hostile batting conditions, but also feast later on an Indian bowling line-up which did well only in patches. "Maybe the retirement decision had everything to do with the way he played. I thought Dean was phenomenal. I haven't seen Dean play any better. If you look at Dean's record, he is second to Graeme (Smith) in terms of opening batters (in South Africa) and that's something to be really proud of. "That's something we want to start highlighting: obviously the team comes first but we also want to talk about individual performances that put us up in lights. With Marco we know his ability and we've seen him do things before. It's with the ball that he has been a bit off the mark," added Conrad. With a 1-0 lead in the two-game series, the second Test at Cape Town starting from January 3 presents the opportunity for South Africa to seal the series in what will also be Elgar's last international game. "Everybody is looking forward to the New Year's Test. There hasn't been one in a while where crowds were allowed in, and if rumours are to be believed, I think the first few days are pretty much sold out. "I think the guys will really be up for it, there is a series to be won. Series wins are special, especially series wins against India, and then we can send Dean off properly â€“ that would put the cherry on top for us," concluded Conrad.

author: SchoolTube Community
title: The Amazing World of Invertebrates: Exploring the Tiny Creatures That Rule the Earth | SchoolTube
text: The Amazing World of Invertebrates: Exploring the Tiny Creatures That Rule the Earth When we think of animals, we often picture majestic lions, playful dolphins, or soaring eagles. But the animal kingdom is far more diverse than these charismatic creatures. In fact, the majority of animal species on Earth belong to a group often overlooked: invertebrates. These creatures, lacking a backbone, are the unsung heroes of our planet, playing crucial roles in ecosystems and contributing to the intricate web of life. What are Invertebrates? Invertebrates are animals without a backbone, or vertebral column. This seemingly simple distinction sets them apart from vertebrates, which include mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians, and fish. While vertebrates may grab the headlines, invertebrates make up a staggering 95% of all animal species. This vast group encompasses a mind-boggling array of creatures, from tiny insects to massive squid, showcasing a remarkable diversity of forms, behaviors, and adaptations. The Incredible Variety of Invertebrates The world of invertebrates is a kaleidoscope of colors, shapes, and sizes. Hereâ€™s a glimpse into some of the major groups: - Insects: The most diverse group of animals on Earth, boasting over a million known species. From the buzzing bees to the colorful butterflies, insects play vital roles in pollination, decomposition, and food chains. - Mollusks: This group includes snails, slugs, clams, oysters, and octopuses. Mollusks are known for their soft bodies, often protected by a hard shell. They are important food sources and contribute to marine ecosystems. - Arthropods: This diverse group includes insects, spiders, crabs, and lobsters. Arthropods are characterized by their jointed legs and exoskeletons, which provide support and protection. - Worms: From the earthworms that enrich our soil to the parasitic roundworms, worms come in many forms. They play crucial roles in decomposition, nutrient cycling, and food chains. - Echinoderms: This group includes starfish, sea urchins, and sea cucumbers. They are characterized by their radial symmetry and spiny skin. Echinoderms are important members of marine ecosystems, contributing to nutrient cycling and providing food for other animals. The Importance of Invertebrates Invertebrates may be small, but their impact on our planet is enormous. They contribute to: - Pollination: Insects like bees and butterflies are essential for the pollination of many plants, ensuring the production of fruits, vegetables, and seeds. - Food Chains: Invertebrates form the base of many food chains, serving as a vital food source for birds, fish, reptiles, and amphibians. - Decomposition: Invertebrates like earthworms and dung beetles play a crucial role in breaking down dead organic matter, returning nutrients to the soil. - Ecosystem Health: Invertebrates help maintain the balance of ecosystems by regulating populations of other organisms and contributing to nutrient cycling. - Human Health: Some invertebrates, like honeybees, provide us with essential products like honey and beeswax. Others, like earthworms, improve soil fertility, benefiting agriculture and food production. Threats to Invertebrates Despite their importance, many invertebrate populations are facing threats from human activities, including: - Habitat Loss: As humans expand their footprint, natural habitats are destroyed, reducing the space available for invertebrates. - Pollution: Chemical pollutants, pesticides, and fertilizers can harm invertebrates and disrupt ecosystems. - Climate Change: Rising temperatures, changes in precipitation patterns, and extreme weather events can negatively impact invertebrate populations. - Invasive Species: Introduced species can outcompete native invertebrates and disrupt ecosystems. Protecting Invertebrates Protecting invertebrates is essential for maintaining the health of our planet and ensuring the well-being of future generations. We can all contribute by: - Reducing our use of pesticides and fertilizers: Choose organic options whenever possible and minimize chemical use in our gardens and lawns. - Conserving natural habitats: Support organizations that protect habitats for invertebrates and create wildlife-friendly gardens. - Educating ourselves and others: Learn about the importance of invertebrates and share this knowledge with others. - Making sustainable choices: Reduce our consumption and waste, support sustainable agriculture, and advocate for policies that protect the environment. The world of invertebrates is a fascinating and vital part of our planet. By understanding their importance and taking action to protect them, we can ensure a healthy and thriving future for all.

author: Carmenmilagro Aulino
title: VIDEO | Edgar RamÃ­rez no disimulÃ³ al conocer las 13 nominaciones de Emilia PÃ©rez en los premios Oscar 2025 #23Ene
text:
El actor venezolano Ã‰dgar RamÃ­rez no pudo ocultar su entusiasmo al enterarse de que la pelÃ­cula Â«Emilia PÃ©rezÂ», en la que participa, ha recibido un impresionante total de 13 nominaciones a la 97Âº ediciÃ³n de los premios Oscar , prevista el 3 de marzo en el teatro Dolby de Los Ãngeles.
En un video publicado en su cuenta de Instagram, se puede ver a Ã‰dgar RamÃ­rez, quien se encuentra actualmente en MilÃ¡n, Italia, saltando de alegrÃ­a al conocer la noticia de las nominaciones de la pelÃ­cula en la que interpretÃ³ al personaje Gustavo Brun.
â€œ13 nominaciones al Oscar para nuestra querida Emilia PÃ©rez. Â¡Esto es increÃ­ble! Muchas gracias, Academia. Â¡QuÃ© dÃ­a tan feliz!â€, escribiÃ³ RamÃ­rez en Instagram.
â€œEmilia PÃ©rezâ€ , una pelÃ­cula francesa en espaÃ±ol de Jacques Audiard, dominÃ³ las nominaciones con 13 nominaciones, incluidas mejor pelÃ­cula y mejor actriz para Karla SofÃ­a GascÃ³n. La pelÃ­cula tambiÃ©n recibiÃ³ nominaciones a mejor direcciÃ³n, guion original, dos de sus canciones y para Zoe SaldaÃ±a.
Nominaciones a Mejor PelÃ­cula Otro musical, â€œ Wicked â€, la exitosa adaptaciÃ³n de Broadway, recibiÃ³ casi la misma cantidad de nominaciones. La suntuosa versiÃ³n de â€œEl mago de Ozâ€ de Jon M. Chu obtuvo 10 nominaciones, incluidas las de mejor pelÃ­cula y mejor interpretaciÃ³n para sus protagonistas, Cynthia Erivo y Ariana Grande.
â€œThe Brutalistâ€ , la epopeya de posguerra de Brady Corbet tambiÃ©n obtuvo 10 nominaciones, incluidas mejor pelÃ­cula, mejor director y nominaciones a la actuaciÃ³n para Adrien Brody, Guy Pearce y Felicity Jones.
Las 10 nominadas a mejor pelÃ­cula son: â€œ Anora â€; â€œThe Brutalistâ€; â€œA Complete Unknownâ€; â€œConclaveâ€; â€œ Dune: Part Two â€; â€œEmilia PÃ©rezâ€; â€œIâ€™m Still Hereâ€; â€œNickel Boysâ€; â€œ The Substance â€ y â€œWickedâ€.
Otras nominaciones en los Oscar Las mayores sorpresas fueron la pelÃ­cula brasileÃ±a â€œ Iâ€™m Still Here â€, un retrato de la resistencia polÃ­tica bajo la dictadura militar de Brasil que tambiÃ©n le valiÃ³ a Fernanda Torres una nominaciÃ³n a mejor actriz, y â€œ Nickel Boys â€ de RaMell Ross, un drama en primera persona audazmente elaborado que reconsidera cÃ³mo se representa la vida y el dolor de los negros en la pantalla.
Una de las pelÃ­culas mÃ¡s audaces de 2024, â€œ The Apprentice â€ obtuvo un par de nominaciones sorprendentes, para Sebastian Stan y Jeremy Strong. La pelÃ­cula dramatiza los aÃ±os de formaciÃ³n del
presidente Donald Trump (Stan) en el sector inmobiliario de Nueva York bajo la tutela del abogado Roy Cohn (Strong).
â€œA nivel artÃ­stico, hoy es un dÃ­a increÃ­ble para mÃ­ y me siento muy felizâ€, aÃ±adiÃ³ Strong sobre su primera nominaciÃ³n al Oscar. â€œTengo sentimientos encontrados sobre el personaje que interpretÃ©. Fue el papel de mi vida y, al mismo tiempo, su legado es real y se estÃ¡ desarrollando in situ, ante nuestros ojos, de maneras muy aterradorasâ€.
Mejor actor y actriz En la categorÃ­a de mejor actor, donde estaban nominados Stan y Brody, los otros nominados fueron TimothÃ©e Chalamet (â€œA Complete Unknownâ€), Colman Domingo (â€œSing Singâ€) y Ralph Fiennes (â€œConclaveâ€). El que mÃ¡s se quedÃ³ fuera fue Daniel Craig, aclamado por su actuaciÃ³n nada al estilo de James Bond en â€œQueerâ€.
En la categorÃ­a de mejor actriz , que Demi Moore parece tener asegurada por su actuaciÃ³n en â€œ The Substance â€, Moore, GascÃ³n, Torres, Erivo y la estrella de â€œAnoraâ€, Mikey Madison, recibieron nominaciones. Posiblemente la categorÃ­a mÃ¡s competitiva del aÃ±o, que dejÃ³ fuera a Marianne Jean-Baptiste (â€œHard Truthsâ€), Pamela Anderson (â€œThe Last Showgirlâ€), Nicole Kidman (â€œ Babygirl â€) y Angelina Jolie (â€œMariaâ€).
Ante la situaciÃ³n tan grave que afecta a la industria cinematogrÃ¡fica, algunos pidieron a la Academia que cancelara los Oscar por completo . Los lÃ­deres de la Academia han argumentado que la ceremonia del 2 de marzo debe seguir adelante, por su impacto econÃ³mico en Los Ãngeles y como sÃ­mbolo de resiliencia.
Los organizadores han prometido que los premios de este aÃ±o Â«celebrarÃ¡n el trabajo que nos une como comunidad cinematogrÃ¡fica global y reconocerÃ¡n a quienes lucharon con tanta valentÃ­a contra los incendios forestalesÂ».

author: Lee Digital Content Center, Dataherald
title: Southwest Airlines faces disruptions during holiday travel
text: Conditions were mostly nice this year for travelers flying ahead of and on Christmas, but some naughty disruptions again plagued those flying with Southwest Airlines. For millions of people traveling over the holiday, this year was much better than last. Christmas morning put a bow on a relatively smooth weekend. Only 157 flights within, into or out of the U.S. had been canceled and 2,111 were delayed as of late afternoon on Monday, according to the tracking website FlightAware. For this holiday season, U.S. airlines prepared for massive waves of travelers by hiring thousands of pilots, flight attendants and other workers â€” in an effort to avoid the delays and cancellations that marred travel in 2022, culminating with the Southwest Airlines debacle that stranded more than 2 million people. People are also readingâ€¦ Still, Southwest experienced hiccups again over the weekend that the airline was looking to clear by Monday. Check out how airline performance has been recently at Midway and O'Hare airports.

author: Reuters
title: Pakistani Christian Community Attacked after Blasphemy Accusation | Newsmax.com
text: Reuters Saturday, 25 May 2024 03:53 PM EDT At least 10 members of a minority Christian community were rescued on Saturday after a Muslim crowd attacked their settlement on blasphemy accusation in eastern Pakistan, police and a community leader said. The crowd, which accused the Christian group of blasphemy, also hurled stones and bricks at the police, said Shariq Kamal, the police chief of Sargodha district. At least one house and a small shoe factory was set on fire by protesters who had gathered after neighbors alleged that the Muslim holy book, the Koran, had been desecrated by a minority community member, according to a police spokesman and Akmal Bhatti, a Christian leader. "They burned one house" and several Christians were badly beaten, Bhatti said. A large contingent of police cordoned off the settlement, Kamal said, adding that the crowd had been pushed back. One member of the Christian community who was taken to hospital was later said to be in a stable condition. The situation had calmed down by late evening, with leaders from both sides calling for peace, police said. A Christian rights group - Minority Rights March - said a 70-year-old man accused of the blasphemy was beaten and dragged by the mob. It said video footage showed that the police did not intervene. The police have denied the claim. Videos posted on social media showed protesters looting items from burning properties. Others were seen throwing the items in a heap on fire in a street. Bhatti said the videos were images from the scene. Reuters could not independently verify the pictures. The independent Human Rights Commission of Pakistan said the Christian community was "at grave risk to their lives at the hands of the charged mobs." Blasphemy is a sensitive subject in conservative Muslim- majority Pakistan, where just an accusation can lead to a street lynching. Human rights groups say Pakistan's harsh blasphemy laws are often misused to settle personal scores. While blasphemy is punishable by death in Pakistan, no one has been executed by the state for it, though numerous accused have been lynched by outraged mobs. A Muslim crowd attacked a Christian community in eastern Pakistan last year, vandalizing several churches and setting scores of houses on fire after accusing two of its members of desecrating the Koran. Â© 2024 Thomson/Reuters. All rights reserved. Receive breaking news and original analysis - sent right to your inbox. Newsmax, Moneynews, Newsmax Health, and Independent. author: HNA
title: USA und China: Ansehen beschÃ¤digt - und der Tourismus leidet
text:
USA und China: Ansehen beschÃ¤digt - und der Tourismus leidet
US-PrÃ¤sident Trump wird seinem Land Experten zufolge einen RÃ¼ckgang der Touristenzahlen einbringen. Bisher allerdings muss GroÃŸmacht-Rivale China im Reiseverkehr grÃ¶ÃŸere EinbuÃŸen hinnehmen.
MÃ¼nchen/Peking - Im globalen Reiseverkehr haben Krisen und Konflikte der vergangenen Jahre China bislang mehr geschadet als den USA. Die beiden groÃŸen deutschen FlughÃ¤fen Frankfurt und MÃ¼nchen melden auch nach dem Amtsantritt von US-PrÃ¤sident Donald Trump in diesem Jahr bisher einen Anstieg der Passagierzahlen auf den US-Routen, im China-Verkehr hingegen einen RÃ¼ckgang. Und im direkten Vergleich der jeweiligen weltweiten Besucherzahlen haben die Vereinigten Staaten China seit 2019 Ã¼berholt.
Fachwelt erwartet Trump-Krise im US-Tourismus
Der MÃ¼nchner Flughafen zÃ¤hlte von Januar bis Mai knapp 1,2 Millionen Passagiere im Flugverkehr mit den USA â€“ fast 37.000 mehr als ein Jahr zuvor. Auch in Frankfurt legten die Fluggastzahlen in den ersten vier Monaten â€“ noch ohne Mai â€“ um 7.600 auf 944.300 zu. Das deutet bisher nicht auf einen riesigen Trump-Effekt. Allerdings ist diesen Daten nicht zu entnehmen, ob die Flieger mehrheitlich mit US-BÃ¼rgern oder EuropÃ¤ern besetzt waren. Die Zahlen beinhalten sowohl abfliegende als auch ankommende Passagiere.
Dass Trumps zweite Amtszeit dem US-Tourismus schaden wird, ist Konsens in der Fachwelt: Nach SchÃ¤tzung des in London ansÃ¤ssigen Welttourismusverband WTTC und des Beratungsinstituts Oxford Economics kommen auf die USA in diesem Jahr Einnahmeverluste von Ã¼ber zwÃ¶lf Milliarden Dollar zu, weil AuslÃ¤nder fernbleiben. Der â€žSpiegelâ€œ widmete der Trump-bedingten Reisekrise die Titelgeschichte seiner jÃ¼ngsten Ausgabe.
China-Tourismus: Pandemie wirkt nach, Ukraine-Krieg schadet
Auf den China-Flugrouten von und nach MÃ¼nchen und Frankfurt sind die Passagierzahlen in diesem Jahr bereits geschrumpft: um 1.300 auf knapp 203.000 Passagiere wÃ¤hrend der ersten fÃ¼nf Monate in MÃ¼nchen. In den ersten vier Monaten in Frankfurt waren es 180.300 FluggÃ¤ste, die nach China flogen oder von dort ankamen, 27.000 weniger als ein Jahr zuvor.
